name: Summer Dixon
text: The food was really pretty but it didn't taste like nun for real just a lot of stuff thrown together (loaded fries)might just be me though cause i like my food seasoned😅. The burger was delicioussssss and the wings(sweet heat) I've never had that flavor and it was nice. The lady's severing the food on the other hand were very polite and patient.

name: Elijah King
text: I got the seafood platter and top fries. Everything was excellent!

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed Tops!!

name: Kevin Stein
text: This is hands down some of the best food I've ever eaten. I had the philly and my wife had a burger with wings. The meat in the philly was seasoned so deliciously, and the slightly sweet bun made it that much better. I would eat here every day if I lived in town

name: Shannon Moore
text: Me and my husband just went there today for our first time Let me say The food was hitting they will have my business for sure 👍 😋 And They are such nice people Oh and the cookies are to die for yummy 😋

name: Anne Martin
text:
I'll probably passed this food truck I can't tell you how many times. Looking for a good food truck experience and feeling like I want to indulge in some carbs today, I found this little jewel on Facebook.

It's in a parking lot right off of Holcombe Ave, you can't miss it. It's next to a barbershop, so there's limited parking.

You walk up to the window to place your order. They have several pictures so you can get an idea of what they offer. I also recommended going to their Facebook page for more pictures and the menu. There's so much to choose from I think it's best to make a decision before you get there or you might get a little carried away, which is okay too.

Customer service was okay. Now let's get to the food.

Decided to just go all in, so I can sample a few things and got the $18 box with  cheeseburger, wings and Big Top fries.

When you place your order they don't get a name, they just tell you how long it's going to be, she told me 15 minutes. I waited a little longer than 15 minutes but it wasn't a big deal, when I did get everything it was hot and delicious.

The burger was small but it was very good. It had a nice sear on the patty, the bun was soft, the tomato and the lettuce were fresh, it was great. The wings were fried just like I like them, crispy. The sauce, I'm not sure what it was, but it was fantastic. I could have sucked the bones on these wings, they were absolutely amazing.

But the star of the show, definitely,  were these Big Top fries. We're talking smooth, creamy cheese, shrimp, bacon, and some type of steak.  Baabee, woo, so good.

Let me tell you something, make your way to Holcombe Ave,  get a plate of deliciousness and tell me all about it. Shoot, if you let me know 24 hours in advance, I might even meet you over there.

Those fries though. The flavor was delicious.  The cheese kissed every single fry.  The fries, soaked with this creamy deliciousness, we're still crispy enough to handle it.  "Muah"

Check these guys out if you're ever in the area!

name: Linda Pettis
text: My order was okay...i expected different🤔

name: Michelle Hill West
text: Always a great experience

name: Sha Williams
text: Omg, one day my family and I was visiting Mobile Alabama and decided to stop at Tops. It was 3 of us, everyone tried something different. I had the grill pork chops, one had shrimp and the other one had a burger. This was the best food we ever tasted. We will be stopping by again when we come back to Alabama.

resp.text: Thank you! We are delighted that you enjoyed are food while you were visiting Mobile, AL.

name: Demaja Price
text: Man those wings and burgers was on point . Keep up the good work TOP’s. Defiantly will be revisiting. Best food truck in the city. Hands down.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting Tops it is very important that are customers are satisfied.

name: Julese Averhart
text: Food was outstanding and amazing most definitely my new food spot!! Great food and Great customer service😊

resp.text: We are so glad that you enjoyed Tops we appreciate your business.

name: Maisha James
text: From Arkansas, but we stopped through surprisingly the customer service was great but the food was even better The special sauce on the wings and my daughter had a cheeseburger it was delicious will definitely stopped thru on each visit.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting Tops. We are so happy that you were pleased with our service.

name: Lettie Duke
text: Delicious!

name: Kenya Watkins
text: This food truck has great food with great prices! I eat here frequently best food in the city of Mobile!!

name: Lemuel Hill
text: Good  ice cream

name: Gary Holt
text: $1.50 for a big hot dog and drink, you can't go wrong with that, besides Costco's a great place to shop.

name: new placesacct
text: I eat here all the time its really good!!

name: Drew Douglas
text: Always hot and fresh hotdogs and pizza. The grilled chicken salad is good as well. Great place to grab a quick lunch for a good price.

name: Joe Birdwell
text: Always a good idea to grab a slice or hotdog on the way out the store.

name: Dustin Ingram
text: Easy to miss from 1st Ave as it is tucked in a short strip, but do not be deceived! Piper and Leaf has a wide and flavorful selection of hot and iced teas, samples available, and answers for all your questions. They also have a beautiful gift sample set. The Briar Patch tea is so tasty. This will be a regular stop on every future visit to Birmingham, but I may also take to their website to supplement in the meantime.

name: Carrie Rollwagen
text:
The magic of Piper & Leaf starts with the tea itself — it's phenomenal. They use a lot of locally sourced ingredients, and the flavors are unbelievable. The Old Fashioned Birthday Cake really does taste like birthday cake (I even get the unsweet version, and it still tastes that way — I don't understand it, but I'll take it.) I also love their chais and their seasonal flavors — well, it's really all pretty great.

Piper & Leaf is famous for their jars of iced sweet tea and their flavor selection, but they can also do unsweet tea and any of their teas hot as well. They have teas available to order and drink, and they also have loose leaf and sachets available. (Their loose leaf teas come in bags that can also act as tea strainers in a pinch, which is pretty great.) The loose leaf teas come with instructions for how to brew a cup of hot tea, a jar of iced tea, or even as a bigger batch if you're brewing for a large group. This location has coffee as well.

I've always had the friendliest service at Piper & Leaf — they take time to hear you out, help you find the tea that will work best for you, and make sure you leave happy. I couldn't recommend them more; their fans are extremely dedicated, and for good reason.

name: Grace
text:
Piper and leaf has definitely set itself apart from all other tea joints. The first time I tried P&L was in Huntsville and I was extremely excited when I heard about the Birmingham location. We can all take pride in this locally owned business and their down to earth attitude! My first time visit to the Woodlawn location was very similar to Huntsville, great people willing to serve and fill you in on anything you would like to know about the tea! Sammy is a wonderful employee and very helpful.

I love that they keep their customers up to date via social media at all times.
It's always worth the trip and I look forward to their possible grand opening in August.

name: I Branch
text: really nothing but enjoyable experiences here, i'll be back. the place has a cool atmosphere. they have a lot of great reviews for a reason.

name: debbie berry
text: the staff was very friendly and attentive. the bill was reasonable.

name: Shane Oliver
text: Piper and Leaf - A little pricier than the grocery store stuff. Best tea I have ever had.

name: M Mishka
text: Love piper and leaf, so happy they opened up a store closer to me than their Lowes mill location. Awesome tea and friendly workers. Great place to drink tea and chat.

name: Mandy Nobles
text: Awesome tea! Great staff and lots of food choices at Pizitz.

name: P Hill
text: Tea was wonderful, staff helpful, and love specials.

name: Morgan Rouse
text: found them at the market at pepper place farmers market and fell in love with their teas. will definitely make this a frequent stop!!!

name: Caleb Townes
text: Small and upcoming shop, but that does not take away from the great and friendly staff. Not to mention the amazing tea

resp.text:
Caleb,
Thank you so much for the 5 star rating a lovely review! We still have a lot of work to do. Thank you for being part of our building and growth process. Reviews on Google, Facebook, Yelp, etc really helps small businesses like us be found. We appreciate you!
Connor and the Piper and Leaf family

name: Amy Johnston
text: Must try the strawberry teas

name: Victor Hudson
text: By far  the worst food. I got 1 meat and 2 sides 11 dollars and corn bread. It was all hard and maccheese  taste like water down noodles cabbage  was so hard barley  could  chew it this is last time visiting

name: Todd Hooper
text: I was in the mood to eat some vegetables.  This place allows you to order a vegetable plate, and they have a lot of vegetable sides to choose from.  The quality of the food is good for a food court shop.

name: Kimberly Vega
text: I’ve eaten at this place for years and after dropping $36 dollars on lunch for my family they refused to give us condiments. Who charges for condiments?!  I won’t go back.

name: HERBS FOR LIFE
text: The quality of this food and service is a gift from every God ever to exist. The food is holy and heavenly. I am in awe and in great appreciation of my life at this very moment..each bite is a cluster of excellence simmered in love. THANK YOU FOR THIS SOUL FOOD

name: Brody Griffin
text: Was looking for a quick veggie lunch and found this little spot in the food court as one of the few vendors that did not have a dozen or more people in line. Got a 3 side veggie tray for only 5.99, not a bad price for the food I got. It was hot, fresh, and well seasoned.

name: Adam Frank
text:
My wife is vegetarian - that makes it hard sometimes to get food she enjoys when traveling. We were passing through Birmingham en route to Dallas and needed something quick to eat near the hotel.

We were greeted with a friendly face by someone who showed my wife plenty of options at a very affordable price. She loved the food.

Our only regret is we don't live here and can't come back. All the food here that we tried was spectacular. Highly recommend.

name: Megan Harris
text: Did not care for the dish I tried to many peppers and onions..had the Grilled Shrimp dinner

name: peyton blickenstaff
text: I have been really sick lately and doctors cannot figure out what's wrong with me and I was frantically trying to find soup at the mall because I was working and needed to eat but could not eat solids and no one had soup. Thankfully a woman at the farmers basket caught my attention and was very motherly and sweet about it and said she made some homemade chicken noodle soup for her coworkers and gave me some. She is the reason I feel better at this moment and I just wanted to say how sweet she was and how thankful I am that she found me in my state of panic. I can't remember her name but someone needs to give her a raise because she's amazing. Unlike the rest of the fast food mall workers who clearly don't want you there.

name: Vincent Wilhite
text: I love this place every time I go to the Galleria I eat here.The staff is very nice. The prices are good.

name: Brad Hamilton
text: 5 star rating for a mall food court joint? Yep, because Farmer's Basket is legit. It's 2 Legit to Quit (eating there). Get drawn in by the samples, and stay for the quantities and prices. You can literally feed the whole family with one meal (I know because I did). Two meats, and two vegetables go a long way when they pack out a styrofoam to-go container. The crispy honey chicken is not to be missed, and the fried chicken tenders are spot on. Love that you can get soul food and Asian in one spot

name: Fullypure Formarriage
text: Yummy wholesome comfort food to fill this big belly! Thanks all!!!

resp.text: Hi Richard, thanks so much for dining with us, Farmers Basket and thanks again one more time for leaving a kind comment about our cuisine, service, and rating!! Hope we have another chance to serve you right again in the very near future! Most importantly, stay safe! 😊

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review and kind words, Margaret! We appreciate you. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Amanda Partridge
text: Fabulous from start to finish. The young lady who helped me went above and beyond to make my husband's birthday cookies the best they could be. I couldn't have asked for anything more. The entire experience, from order to pick up, was smooth and comfortable. Thanks, yall!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-star review! We really appreciate you! 😊

name: Gina Perkins
text: So we walk in at 8:55pm. They have already covered all ice cream and cookies. The manager is counting down the drawer. He asked can I help you (he should have said we are closed) and I told him 1 scoop of cotton candy ski jump. He quickly said I have already closed the ice cream. So bacisly, they are closed at 8:55pm. If the door is unlocked, wouldn't you believe they are opened? Very Rude. Couldnt care less a paying customer was there.  Won't spend my money or time here ever again. This is the new normal in America. His business must be one that is NOT struggling!!! Good Luck to you!!!

resp.text: We are so sad to hear that you had a less than 5-star experience! Please contact our customer service team at customerservice@gfgmanagement.com, referencing this review.

name: L Cannon
text: I AM NEVER GOING BACK TO THIS PLACE!!!! The manager needs some very important training on customer service. My son and I was here yesterday. The cashier got the order wrong. She called my son a liar after he explained that the order was wrong. She said she can’t take my son’s word over her employee and he should respect that. No you should respect that your rude behavior is costing you customers. It took everything in me not to respond like you. Even the customer you were helping decided to take a pic of his order request because of my experience. That says a lot. Sometimes a little kindness goes a long way instead you lost a customer because of your rude behavior.

resp.text: We are so sad to hear that you had a less than 5-star experience! Please contact our customer service team at customerservice@gfgmanagement.com and let us know what happened.

name: Sticky Waffles
text: I ordered a cake from this location and when I went to pick up the cake I was told it wasn’t done and they were not going to be doing it???? The worker was rather rude too. I asked for the manager and she claimed to be the manager so I left. I didn’t want to drive out to the Galleria today, but I ended up doing it and that location took cake of my cake.

resp.text: We are so sad to hear that you had a less than 5-star experience! Please contact our customer service team at customerservice@gfgmanagement.com and let us know what happened.

name: Geneva Talmadge
text: Ice cream is the best with exciting new flavors every month. Cookies are super.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 stars, Geneva! We appreciate you.

name: michael c
text: My wife and son were treated horribly here. Employee gave my son the wrong order, told him he could not return the cookies because of COVID-19. The store manager told my son that it was his word against the employee’s and he would just have to respect that. So after basically calling my son a liar my wife goes in and the same store manager lies and says she didn’t say this to my son and attempts to chastise my wife about how my son was wrong. Mind you, the employee that got the order wrong  just stands there and allows my son to take the blame for his mistake, he says nothing. Long story short, my wife wasn’t having it she threw the wrong order in the trash at the store, the store manager still had to give her the correct order and we will never purchase anything from there again.

resp.text: Michael, we are so sad to hear that you had a less than 5-star experience! Please contact our customer service team at customerservice@gfgmanagement.com referencing this review and let us know what happened.

name: Macey Franklin
text: Can never get a cake from this location. Have had two, several  day advances notice, online orders “overlooked”. Then tried calling the day before so another one and told they can’t squeeze it in. Usually use the Brookwood location, but it is temporarily closed. Hope it opens again!

resp.text: We are so sad to hear that you had a less than 5-star experience! Please contact our customer service team at customerservice@gfgmanagement.com and let us know what happened.

resp.text: KandkR, we are so sad to hear that you had less than a 5 star experience! Please know that we have informed the franchise owner due to the fact that each location is independently owned and operated!

name: Jasmine Pettaway Kemp REALTOR
text: This was my third trip and it was good as always. Service was quick and the employees were polite and suggested great combinations. The employees were following COVID-19 protocol and the store front was marked accordingly. I’ve cream was packaged to-go and stayed cold and composed the entire 20 minute ride home.

name: Rachel Leyva
text: Workers had masks below nose, seemed annoyed that I had questions about mix ins, and I stood in front of the checkout counter while two ladies stood behind the counter chatting. One was texting on her phone with her gloves on. When one worker finally realized I was waiting to check out, she told the other employee “she’s been standing here to check out and you on your phone” to which the other employee replied “I’m not at work right now.” The girl said “You’ve been saying that all day”. How is this acceptable behavior?  This is my second time coming to this location and it has been HORRIBLE both times. Don’t waste your time here. You will be so mad after leaving that you won’t even taste the sub-par ice cream. Total time in store getting a cup of ice cream? 15 MINUTES. And no other customers were getting ice cream.

name: George Davis
text: Horrible experience. Workers all had masked below nose or below chin, no distancing between the workers, orders were wrong after clearly stating them multiple times, ice cream was melted, and way over priced. Ice cream was just not good either. I loved Maggie Moo's, and I've been there numerous times in the northeast. However, this was not the standard I remembered. Will not be back

name: rebekah lusk
text: Terrible service. None of the employees knew answers about the menu, menu wasn’t even showing on the TV, and no one made any effort to tell me menu options even after asking multiple times. Did not even end up getting what I ordered, even though I repeated it. When I pointed out that the order was wrong, the worker was rude to me I typically love marble slab and will put up with the price for good ice cream and service, but certainly never coming back to this location.

text: Absolutely love these Philly Steak Sandwiches!  They are so tasty, i am looking forward to Returning to Alabama just so i can go back and eat again :)  Only thing that is annoying is i have to go into that huge mall to get me some Philly Steak.  Wish i could sacrifice a meal so i could try something different, I am sure it would be just as good but i can't not have my usual.

name: David Gardner
text: Good cheese steak at reasonable price, for a mall food court.  A couple of caveats:  Unless you tell them NOT to, they will put mayonnaise, lettuce, and tomato on it.  (Mayo on a cheese steak...Have mercy!)  And they'll also put that damn seasoning salt on your fries unless you tell them not to.

name: chico chang
text: Good

name: Heather Beaudet
text: This place is amazing! Wonderful food and great customer services! This was my first time here and I loved it! I will definitely be coming back!

resp.text: Hey, we appreciate the review!

name: John Doe
text:
This place is hit or miss.  I love eating at Charley's but not so much here at FT Rucker.  I've been here for 6 months now.  The first few weeks, I came here to eat several times but each time it just kept getting worse.  Now, it's almost the last place I'll go and eat at.
There were times when I walk up to order, only one ordering, and it's like I'm not there.  They keep talking to each other, though they saw me walk up.  It's like they have to finish up on talking about their lives or other people and then they can help you.  it's my lunch break...I don't have time for you guys to finish.  I need my food so I can go back to work.
Also, when they cut up my steak, then cut up someone else's raw chicken, then go back to fixing up my steak...I'm pretty sure that's a health violation and dangerous.  They preach that you never cross contaminate but these folks do.  I just pray that the spatula they are using is super hot and kills the salmonella.
Also, if I get the special fries that come with ranch on it...I don't need 80% ranch, and 10% fries.  I like ranch on my fries but not drowning in ranch so much it comes out of the to go carrier box.  Then I have to toss them in the garbage.
The folks here need real management or a better supervisor.  Cause at the moment, I know myself and others where I work, will not go back.  Places like this need to get away with hooking friends and family up.  That's all I see on Ft Rucker and probably why most things go down hill. I know they might be your cousin or brother but if they can't do the job...fire them.

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear that you had an unpleasant experience at one of our locations, John. Feel free to email shareyourstuff@charleys.com if you would like to provide more information on how we could have improved your experience.

name: Brandon Lewis
text: The last 2 times I have been here they have no trays for you to eat off of. I have had to go get a dirty tray off of a trash can. I think its about time some of these garbage employees lose their cushy little job on fort rucker. Pretty sad that they just blow you off when you tell them they have no trays

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear that you had an unpleasant experience at one of our locations, Brandon. Feel free to email shareyourstuff@charleys.com if you would like to provide more information on how we could have improved your experience.

name: Micala Mayle
text: Every time this charleys is a disappointment and a waste of money.

resp.text: Oh no! That's not something we want to hear, we are sorry we have not met your expectations. Will you please email us at feedback@charleys.com with some details about your experiences. We want to make things right! Thanks, Micala.

name: Christina Anderson
text: Excellent service. Food is good.

resp.text: We appreciate the kind words and 5-star review, Christina!

name: Kenneth S
text: Amazing food, always hits the spot, great customer service as well

resp.text: Thanks so much for the review, Kenneth, and come back anytime to see us!

name: midecarft best
text: Closest thing I can get to a real philly. However, wish they put more meat on the sandwiches

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review!

name: Elizabeth Bentley
text: Don't go here! They will charge you for things and not give them to you. Even after you show them your receipt to prove you paid for your items. Worst customer service. I've never had to argue with someone at a restaurant before and I can't believe they would even argue with a customer. DON'T GO!

name: Laird Culver
text: Try the chicken cordon bleu with banana peppers. Service is fast and friendly.

name: Courtney Westrick
text: Great cheesesteaks

resp.text: Courtney, thanks so much for the review and we hope you come back in again soon!

name: Joseph kyle Davis
text: Good food

resp.text: Hey, Joseph, we appreciate the comments and the 5-star review!

name: GM Cris
text: Great sandwiches.

name: the daly Fam
text: Great new owners! DALYFAM

name: Michaeljoe “Hillbilly” Hillis
text: Love you..my sandwich is always fantamatastic & Tabitha Lee is my favorite food preparation Girly smile and a great kid

name: Jesse Kennamer
text: The people are nice the breakfast is better than the average small store. I keep going back because it feels like home, country, slow paced, good folks and food.

name: Krystal Alderman
text: Owners are very professional,  and each of the shift assistance workers, are very kind, respectful, and precise with food orders. I love Lynette J., she is my #1. 😁

name: Denise Hammock
text: Always great prices on cigarettes and very sweet lil man who runs it...💞💕

name: Angela Bergquist
text: Convenient but prices are high

name: Zach Melson
text: Awesome local business. Great couple that owns it. Notice as can be. Kristi the cook is excellent. Cooks the best food. Excellent customer service and always has a smile and something nice to lift every Spirit

name: Italian Guy
text: Amazing staff and always willing to go out of their way to help. Except the creepy big white guy that works nights and has issues with short changing people (heard from many) and coming onto Woman from the counter.

name: Kristy Hammock
text: So sweet. Food is great to come from a gas station. Ruby is the best when cooking.

name: RUSTY TOWERS
text: Older  store but  only gass for a minute

name: Lisa Clark
text: One star is all I can honestly give. The second time going was only because I had to get gas,otherwise I haven't and hopefully won't have to go back.

name: Jennifer McClure
text: Customer service is good

name: Becky Bales
text: The owners and staff are so nice great people and denise can fix the best EVERYTHING love this place

name: Ben Tipton
text: Friendly owners and good deli

name: Daryl Parker
text: Friendly people. Get a bite to eat. Gas/food/cigarettes. Even have a few items for car maintenance. Nice place.

name: Darren Brazier
text: Close to my house so it's convenient, quite expensive, deli is good

name: Jay's WeldShop
text: Got the best sausage egg and cheese croissant in tony alabama!

name: Ashleyyy Ramos
text: Nice people .

text: Love it, they have really good food and great employees

text: Amazing biscuit but their  canned stuff is always out of date like my sprite I'm looking at

name: tam-me
text: store is not clean.  stock is very limited sans alcoholic beverages.  gas prices not competitive, pumps are old/out-dated.  parking lot is damaged/poor.
